intro: Borreria krausei, commonly known as the Mexican thornapple, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a shrub that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by orange or red berries. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, and the plant has a spiny stem. Borreria krausei is part of the Rubiaceae family and is known for its ornamental value and use in traditional medicine.
